resources.string:
Image Playground 1.0
Copyright 2012 Google Inc. All Rights Reserved.
http://code.google.com/p/image-playground

The script you enter in the text field will be called once for each pixel in the camera image. The script should return an output pixel value created from the gray or rgb functions described below.

These variables will be preinitialized:
y: pixel brightness from 0 to 255
r: red component from 0 to 255
g: green component from 0 to 255
b: blue component from 0 to 255
row: row number of current pixel, where 0 is the top
col: column number of current pixel, where 0 is the left
width: width of the image in pixels
height: height of the image in pixels

Scripts can use standard Java arithmetic and bitwise operators, and can create new variables by assigning them to values. (All variables are integer type). The following functions are available:
abs(x): absolute value of x
min(x,y): smaller of x and y
max(x,y): larger of x and y
clamp(x,a,b): if x is less than a, returns a. If x is greater than b, returns b. Otherwise, returns x itself.
ifgt(x,y,a,b): if x is greater than y, returns a, otherwise returns b.
brightness(row,col): brightness (0-255) of image at row and column
random(x): random integer between 0 and x-1

gray(x): gray color with the given brightness
rgb(r,g,b): color with the given red, green, and blue components
